;习惯于跨越美中分歧的亚洲领导人越来越紧张，因为中美之间的紧张关系世界上的两个超级大国可能会陷入冲突，双方的一系列决定使北京和华盛顿更难找到共同点。

;

;本周在新加坡举行的防务会议本可以成为两国之间的桥梁相反，双方看起来会进一步凸显双方在台湾、高端芯片限制以及中国对南海大片海域的主权主张等问题上的分歧。

;

;“我们中的许多人在东南亚洲对台湾非常紧张，说真的，”马来西亚前外交部长赛夫丁阿卜杜拉说，他的言论得到了其他地区领导人的响应。 “我们非常紧张。”

;

;地缘政治紧张局势加剧笼罩着世界最大经济体之间的商业关系，即使乔·拜登总统和习近平总统转向中国，这些经济体之间的商品贸易仍处于创纪录水平在关键领域变得更加自力更生。

;

;美国和中国存在“不可调和的分歧”，但可以共存：新加坡部长

;

;中国最近几天为全球商业铺开了红地毯包括特斯拉公司的埃隆·马斯克和摩根大通公司首席执行官杰米·戴蒙在内的领导人试图消除对该国对外资越来越敌视的担忧。

;

;但希望周五开始的香格里拉对话将展示美中关系的改善，但当北京拒绝了美国要求国防部长劳埃德奥斯汀和他的国防部长李尚福会面的要求时，这一对话破灭了。几个月来，美国一直寻求谈判，但北京希望取消美国在 2018 年对李嘉诚的制裁，这是拜登政府在排除之前考虑过的一步。

;

;因此，尽管世界最大经济体的军事首脑将本周末在同一家酒店，可能在同一间会议室，他们预计不会交谈。继去年 11 月拜登和习近平在巴厘岛举行有希望的会晤后，这又增加了数月的沟通中断，当时两位领导人试图让两国关系重回正轨。

;

;这并没有发生。

;

;经过一些试探性接触后，2 月份一个据称是中国间谍的气球飘过美国领空，并且拜登政府加大了对中国技术出口的限制，两国关系恢复了下降趋势。

;

;美国及其盟友表示，他们希望与中国“降低风险”，而不是“脱钩”，理由是需要在贸易关系与来自北京的国家安全威胁之间取得平衡。习近平政府拒绝接受这种描述，而是看到美国主导的阴谋是通过加强与台湾、日本、菲律宾、澳大利亚和其他伙伴的防务合作来削弱其增长并包围它。

;

;“一些战略新加坡副总理黄循财上个月在东京举行的一次会议上表示，两国之间的分歧和意识形态分歧似乎无法克服，而且很可能无法调和。

;

;许多亚洲国家——包括美国的盟友——感到陷入困境中间。他们警惕地关注乌克兰正在展开的消耗战，将其视为对如果这两个竞争对手不稳定关系可能发生的后果的严厉警告。

;

;东南亚国家联盟前秘书长 Ong Keng Yong联合国（东盟）表示，华盛顿和北京敏锐地意识到了这些相似之处。

;

;“双方都意识到，他们不能因不经意地陷入军事冲突而犯下错误，”Ong 在接受采访时说. “美国和中国都注意到，如果台湾海峡发生军事对抗，将会出现可怕的局面。”

;

;马尼拉表示，美国不能利用菲律宾储存用于保卫台湾的武器

;

;然而，意外的冲突总是有风险的。五角大楼表示，一架中国战斗机上周在南海上空突然转向一架美国侦察机，这是一种“不必要的侵略性机动”，美国高级官员称这是该地区对抗行为模式的一部分。< /p>;

;在审视该地区的紧张局势时，老挝总统通伦·西苏里 (Thongloun Sisoulith) 哀叹这些艰巨的挑战，如果置之不理，“可能会给世界带来毁灭性的后果。”

;

;缓和，美国和中国正在深入。中国多年来一直在努力将其声称拥有主权的有争议岛屿和露头军事化，并定期派遣战机和船只进入传统的台湾水域。随着朝鲜加强其弹道导弹和核计划，它一直保持沉默。

;

;习近平本周呼吁加大力度实现国家安全防御现代化，并应对在更广泛打击海外数据访问和所谓的专家网络被指控鼓励泄露国家机密。

;

;与此同时，美国一直在寻求加强区域联盟。它赢得了日本和韩国之间更多合作的承诺，并在一些太平洋岛国开设了新大使馆。在与菲律宾关系紧张多年后，它与总统小费迪南德·马科斯合作，获得更多军事设施的使用权，并于 4 月与马尼拉举行了 30 年来最大规模的联合军事演习。

;

;其他国家正在采取行动也。日本首相岸田文雄希望在东京自二战以来最大的安全政策改革中加深与加拿大和其他七国集团国家的防务关系。他还负责监督与澳大利亚扩大的防务协定，其中包括情报共享和更复杂的联合军事演习。

;

;即使美中没有在新加坡举行会议，双方都将寻求巩固对领导地位的要求。五角大楼表示，奥斯汀“将与主要领导人会面，以推进美国在该地区的国防伙伴关系。”

;

;“过去的心态”：Aukus 颠覆了澳大利亚试图采取的美中平衡行动

;

;奥斯汀周六上午在新加坡会议上发表讲话。李周日也做了同样的事情。

;

;在来自 40 个国家的 600 名军方官员和代表中，有些人仍然希望美国和中国代表团能够找到打破僵局的方式，即使是非正式的

;

;但总部位于伦敦的专注于中国的研究公司 Enodo Economics 的首席经济学家戴安娜·乔伊列娃 (Diana Choyleva) 表示，目前要改变关系的方向需要不止一次会议。

;

;“别搞错了，任何改进充其量只是在现有霸权与有抱负的霸权之间不断加剧的全面对抗中稍作停顿，”她说。

;

;

;在此期间，他担任汇丰资产管理（香港）的首席执行官。

;

;在交易所任职期间，他将大陆中国公司将在这里作为 H 股上市，青岛啤酒于 1993 年 7 月 15 日率先上市。

;

;中国大陆公司现在成为市场的核心，超过 1,200 家公司代表超过 80 个市场资本化和营业额的 %。

;

;他还在 1990 年代在香港引入了电子交易和集中清算平台，为市场的现代化和发展奠定了基础。

;

;他的成功作为监管者，他为提升市场质素和效率赢得了券商和公众的尊重和赞誉。

;

;“周保罗先生是一位经验丰富的监管者和改革者，在香港实现了许多重要目标，包括引进H股上市，”六福金融主席兼行政总裁、前港交所董事许超清表示。

;

;与大陆和香港监管机构及其他利益相关者的关系。他的成就为香港 [成为] 筹款中心奠定了基础。”

;

;香港在过去 14 年中有 7 年成为全球最大的筹款中心。

;

;许是Chow的前同事。他们都在 1980 年代在香港经纪公司新鸿基证券工作。

;

;周氏身后留下妻子、两个儿子、两个儿媳和两个孙子。

;一个放弃事业、婚姻和家庭的中国女人大陆社交媒体上为她瘫痪的父亲暖心。

;

;据星空视频报道，来自中国中部河南省的这位年近 40 岁的女性，绰号小草，在父亲康复后优先照顾她。因工伤瘫痪。

;

;在一段广为流传的故事视频中，小草拉着一辆木车，父亲躺在上面，然后用竹竿把他抬到床上。

;

;父女俩在小草出生时母亲去世后一直是单亲家庭，在事故发生前就很亲密。

;

;作为单亲妈妈，小草的父亲对她非常疼爱.当她小时候身体不好时，他找了一份离家很近的工作来照顾她。后来她上了大学，他又换了工作，以保持与女儿的亲密关系。

;

;本科毕业后，小草选择不攻读硕士学位，也没有选择她喜欢的职业道路。为了让父亲过上更好的生活，她转而从事一份收入相对较高的销售工作。

;

;此时，小草开始与一位前工作同事发生关系，这对夫妇打算得到事故发生时已婚。

;

;小草的父亲在工作时从五层楼高处坠落。目前尚不清楚父亲从事的是什么类型的工作。他在事故中幸免于难，但却永远改变了他们的生活。

;

;小草不得不用自己所有的积蓄来支付父亲的医疗费，当这笔钱花光时，她向亲戚朋友借了大笔钱。< /p>;

;她不想给当时的男友增加负担，当时男友曾催促她送父亲去养老院，于是她结束了这段关系。她也辞去了工作，坚持自己照顾父亲。

;

;现在轮到我好好照顾他了，”小草说。

;

;大陆社交媒体被这个故事迷住了。

;

;一人说：“她有一颗金子般的心。 ”

;

;另一人评论说：“如果我处于同样的境地，我不会做和她一样的事。”

;

;关于忠诚的家庭和牺牲的故事经常成为新闻头条在中国。今年3月，一名北方男子听妻子讲述分娩经历后流泪的视频感动了很多网友。

;

;2月，一名北方小女孩靠回收废旧物资赚钱帮父母买家用车 大陆社交媒体喜出望外。

;美国参议院周四投票通过一项有争议的法案，暂停该国 31.4 万亿美元的投资债务上限，几乎结束了可能导致经济灾难性主权违约的政治僵局。

;

;该法案以 63 票对 36 票通过，将提交给乔·拜登总统，他曾敦促立法者将其付诸实施他的办公桌及时避免违约，违约最早可能在周一发生，即所谓的“X 日期”，届时美国财政部将没有足够的资金来偿还其所有债务。

;

;参议院投票是在共和党控制的众议院于周三晚间以 314 票对 117 票的两党投票通过该法案后进行的。

;

;该法案将债务上限暂停至 2025 年 1 月 1 日，允许美国政府支付账单。它必须克服一些立法者的批评，即明年军费开支增长 3.3% 至 8860 亿美元，低于 5% 左右的现行通货膨胀率，因此采购能力下降。

;

;参议院拨款委员会成员、南卡罗来纳州共和党人林赛·格雷厄姆周四早些时候率先发起了这一攻势，当时他警告北京和莫斯科构成的军事威胁不断上升​​，并称众议院通过的法案是“一场胜利”

;

;一些立法者，主要是共和党人，试图通过对该法案提出修正案来阻挠该法案的通过，如果该法案获得通过，则需要在众议院对这些变化进行表决。这几乎肯定会阻止国会在 6 月 5 日之前将法案提交给拜登。

;

;麦卡锡的时刻：美国债务胜利确保了众议院议长的地位

;

;密苏里州共和党参议员乔什霍利，推动了一项修正案，该修正案将对所有从中国进口的产品征收全面关税，直到美国对中国的逆差被消除。

;

;在反驳中，俄亥俄州民主党参议员谢罗德·布朗说：“中国希望我们通过这项修正案，因为如果它通过，美利坚合众国就会违约。他们将在北京欢欣鼓舞。

;

;在修正案的支持者未能获得将其中任何一项写入立法所需的 60 票之后，参议院对债务法案进行了最终投票。

;

;对五角大楼资金的不满最终可能会通过日后的补充支出计划得到解决，这似乎得到了两党的支持。

;

;“国防预算不足的第一个问题可以通过以下方式解决和补救Politico 引用缅因州排名靠前的拨款共和党人 Susan Collins 在投票前表示。

;

;因为我们知道这个预算不足以应对我们面临的全球威胁。”

;

;罗德岛州民主党参议院武装部队主席杰克·里德说，华盛顿可能需要采取这样的措施来继续支持乌克兰的努力反击俄罗斯的入侵。

;

;“我认为对于乌克兰，你将不得不有一个补充，”他说。 “我们也可能会加入一些其他东西。”

;一座致力于 34 年前天安门广场镇压的新博物馆将在纽约开放周五，在香港的一家博物馆因国家安全调查而被迫关闭两年后。

;

;博物馆背后的中国持不同政见者——包括王丹，王丹在事件发生后在北京最受通缉的学生名单上排名第一1989 年镇压 – 表示香港在其改写的政治格局下失去了在中国大陆推进民主的独特作用。

;

;“香港对中国的民主和自由无能为力。在 6 月 4 日周年纪念日之前，王告诉邮报。

;

;国家安全警察在 2021 年指控香港支持中国爱国民主运动联盟，该联盟是该市年度守夜活动的组织者维多利亚公园以纪念镇压，其三名领导人煽动颠覆国家政权。

;

;该部队还冻结了该集团的所有资产，价值数百万港元，包括其位于旺角的 6 月 4 日博物馆

;该联盟后来投票解散。

;

;在过去的 30 年里，这座城市是中国土地上唯一举行大规模 6 月 4 日纪念活动的地方.

;

;当局并未以国家安全为由取缔纪念活动，但已禁止“其他活动”，包括从 2020 年起因公共卫生问题在铜锣湾维多利亚公园举行的守夜活动。

;

;今年，26 个亲北京联合会将于周六在公园举行为期三天的嘉年华会，但他们否认该活动旨在阻止该空间的其他用途。

;

;香港保安局长在 6 月 4 日周年纪念日前警告闹事者

;

;王和其他天安门领导人曾计划在香港博物馆被迫关闭后建立一个新的 6 月 4 日博物馆，并在他们筹集资金后于周五实现了这一目标不到 8 个月的时间就达到了 50 万美元（390 万港元）。

;

;Wang 说，位于纽约第六大道 894 号的新博物馆——指的是镇压行动的日期——吸引的大陆游客将少于

;

;但他强调博物馆不只是为中国人而设，而是对全球感兴趣。

;

;“我们希望与香港的高中合作纽约，这样学生们在了解中国并更好地了解这个国家的历史时就可以参观博物馆。”美国，也是大陆游客的热门目的地。

;

;在 2,000 平方英尺博物馆的展品中，有血迹斑斑的衬衫、士兵头盔、帐篷和 1989 年的传单。

;

;天安门学生领袖周锋硕当时在北京通缉名单上排名第五，并参与了展览的策划，他说，一些香港人贡献了他们收集的有关镇压的剪报，以及多年来为纪念天安门事件而制作的纪念品。

;

;他补充说，博物馆中还有一个香港部分，展示香港在维多利亚公园举行的烛光守夜活动，以及 2014 年争取更大民主的社会运动，如占中运动。

;中国一名沉迷网络游戏的13岁女孩花了44.95万元（ 64,000 美元）她在四个月内从她母亲的应用程序游戏中偷走了，这震惊了大陆社交媒体。

;

;来自中国中部河南省的一名不愿透露姓名的中学生在沉迷于她母亲的游戏应用程序后从她母亲那里偷了东西

;

;女孩的母亲，姓王，直到一位老师告诉她，她担心这个女孩花了很多时间在手机上后，她担心这个女孩沉迷于在线付费游戏，才发现这起盗窃案

;

;据大象新闻报道，当王女士检查她的银行余额时，她发现她的账户中只有 0.5 元（0.07 美元）。

;

;在与新闻报道一起发布的一段病毒视频中, Wang is shown flipping through bank statements detailing every transaction her daughter made paying for the online games.

;

;When her father confronted the girl about her spending, she admitted she had spent 120,000 yuan (US$17,000) buying the games, 210,000 yuan for in-game purchases, and 100,000 yuan buying games for at least 10 of her classmates.

;

;“When they asked me to pay for their games, I paid despite feeling reluctant,” the girl explained in the video.

;

;The girl said that she did not understand much about money or where it came from and when she found a debit card at home, she just linked it to her smartphone.

;

;She also remembered her mother telling her the card's password in case she needed money when they were not around.

;

;She said that although she was frightened by the out-of-control requests to buy games from classmates, she was scared to seek help from her teachers.

;

;“My parents will find out and get angry,” the girl said.

;

;Wang said her daughter had deleted all the transaction records on her smartphone, so she knew nothing until the teacher called her.

;

;The story has gone viral on Chinese social media.

;

;One person said: “A girl, aged 13 years old, already knows what she is doing, but she just doesn't want to admit it.”

;

;Another person commented: “It's the parents' own fault.”

;

;A 2022 McGill University report on smartphone addiction studied 34,000 people, aged between 15 and 35, in 24 countries, including the United States and Japan, and found China accounting for the highest number of addicts, followed by Saudi Arabia and Malaysia.

;

;In 2021, a 13-year-old girl in southern China stabbed her mother with a knife after the latter complained about her smartphone addiction.

; Fri, 02 Jun 2023 09:20:02 +0800 China’s Bronze Age Shang dynasty gives up more of its secrets from 3,600 years agohttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/science/article/3222632/chinas-bronze-age-shang-dynasty-gives-more-its-secrets-3600-years-ago?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.02 09:00;
;;

;Four archaeological sites dating back 3,600 years have offered new insights into one of the earliest Chinese dynasties, including an early indoor heating system, the likely use of moats for city protection, as well as painted pottery and turquoise jewellery as markers of status.

;

;The sites belonging to the ancient Shang dynasty (1600BC-1046 BC) were recently discovered in the capital Beijing, its adjacent Hebei province, as well as the northwestern Shaanxi and central Henan provinces, according to China's National Cultural Heritage Administration.

;

;The discoveries from the sites paint a historically valuable picture of city construction, social systems, burial etiquette and handicraft production of what is regarded as the second Chinese dynasty, the administration said in a statement on Tuesday. The Bronze Age dynasty is also the first Chinese royal line backed by historical evidence.

;

;Among the finds were nine tombs of high-ranking nobility from the late Shang dynasty, the largest burial site of its kind ever unearthed in northern Shaanxi.

;

;These were found in the Zhaigou site situated on 11 hills featuring large rammed earth buildings, cemeteries and bronze-casting shops.

;

;More than 200 burial objects were recovered from the tombs, including a set of accessories placed on chariots and horses, a swallow-shaped ornament inlaid with turquoise, a bone tool with animal patterns also inlaid with turquoise, cloud-shaped gold earrings, copper arrowheads, copper axes, sea shells, jade and crocodile bone.

;

;Researchers said the tombs offered insights into the political structure of the Shang dynasty and interactions between the Shang and northern cultures.

;

;At the Xingong ruins in Beijing, one of the earliest Bronze Age settlements discovered in the capital, archaeologists found tombs laid out in order and facing in the same direction, suggesting a form of town planning.

;

;Some of the tombs also held burial objects such as painted pottery, jade and gold earrings, turquoise necklaces and red agate beads, reflecting the high social status of those buried.

;

;Analysis of the remains also showed that people across different social levels ate a similar diet of millets and meat.

;

;Researchers said the findings could shed light on Bronze Age cultural exchanges between people living in the Yan Mountains area of Beijing and the northern grasslands.

;

;Ancient Chinese gold mask raises wealth of questions about Shang culture

;

;Some remarkable urban planning findings related to the Huanbei Shang site in Henan, once a capital city of the mid-Shang dynasty that was first discovered in 1999.

;

;Archaeologists studying the area over the past two years found that a part of the city was surrounded by ditches, instead of rammed earth walls as previously thought. They also found clues pointing to potential passageways and bridges to access the city.

;

;The findings could change the understanding of ancient urban layouts, researchers said, as they indicated walls were not seen as the only way to protect a city.

;

;The fourth site, near Handan city in southern Hebei province, used to be a key military location during the Shang dynasty. The medium-sized settlement relating to the late Shang and subsequent Zhou dynasty was found to contain burial areas, roads, moats, pottery kilns, stone waterways and rows of houses.

;

;In one of the houses, researchers found an indoor structure for heat circulation, which could be an early form of the Chinese kang, an ancient system of using a heated platform to keep homes warm over the long northern winter.

;

;As the first Chinese dynasty with written historical records, the Shang are believed to mark the start of Chinese civilisation and culture.

;

;They are believed to have invented or used the basic tools and techniques needed to make a society grow, such as writing, farming, social ceremonies, chariots or weapons for warfare and political organisation.

; Fri, 02 Jun 2023 09:20:02 +0800 Bali issues do’s and dont’s list for tourists after spate of shocking scandalshttps://www.scmp.com/week-asia/lifestyle-culture/article/3222636/bali-issues-dos-and-donts-list-tourists-after-spate-shocking-scandals?utm_source=rss_feed

;;

;Indonesia's resort island of Bali has issued a new set of rules for foreign tourists in a bid to rein in misbehaving visitors, amid a flurry of incidents that have underlined the consequence of unchecked mass tourism to the Hindu-majority destination.

;

;On Wednesday, Bali governor Wayan Koster issued a circular that outlined 12 obligations for international travellers to follow, alongside eight restrictions on their behaviour. These include respect for sacred temples, statues, customs, arts and culture; modest dress in sacred areas and at tourist attractions; politeness; complying with traffic laws; and conducting transactions using Indonesian rupiah.

;

;The don'ts list spans trespassing on sacred land; climbing sacred trees; engaging in behaviour that defiles sacred places – such as taking indecent or nude photos; using single-use plastics; uttering offensive words and acting aggressively towards government officials, members of local communities or fellow tourists; and engaging in work without the proper permits.

;

;“[I ask] all parties to seriously understand, implement and socialise this circular letter to all staff and foreign tourists visiting Bali,” Koster told reporters on Wednesday.

;

;On the same day, Koster, who is a ranking official of the ruling PDI-P party, also gathered all regents and mayors in Bali to follow the order of his party's matriarch, former Indonesian president Megawati Sukarnoputri, who has previously voiced her annoyance at foreign tourists' misbehaviours in Bali.

;

;“If you can't [manage foreign tourists], you don't have to run for the second period [in next year's elections], that's all. Don't just be ambitious but don't want to do something committed and dedicated,” an angry Koster told his subordinates on Wednesday.

;

;The governor later reiterated his intention to ban foreign and domestic tourists from climbing the island's 22 holy mountains, an idea that he coined this year but has yet to be implemented, alongside other policies such as banning foreigners from renting motorcycles.

;

;The circular comes amid a flurry of head-shaking headlines involving unruly tourists, with the latest being a Danish woman facing 10 years in jail after exposing herself while riding pillion on a motorbike in Seminyak, a tourist hotspot. A German tourist last week was sent to a mental health institution for nakedly gatecrashing a dance performance at a holy temple, while in April, a Russian woman was deported after posing nude in front of a 700-year-old sacred banyan tree.

;

;'I will not be coming back': tourists' outrage over Bali motorbike ban

;

;On Monday, the Bali police also arrested the Indonesian owner of a car rental business for accepting cryptocurrency as a payment method, making the unnamed 33 year-old the first business owner in the country to be arrested for transacting in a digital currency. In Indonesia, cryptocurrency is only allowed to be traded as an asset, while rupiah remains the only recognised currency for payments.

;

;Law and Human Rights Minister Yasonna Laoly revealed on Wednesday during a hearing with lawmakers in the House of Representative in Jakarta that 132 foreign tourists had been deported from Indonesia between January-May, adding that he would continue to “deport and blacklist” any unruly visitors. The ministry's Bali branch deported 194 foreigners last year.

;

;Agung Suryawan Wiryanatha, head of the centre of excellence in tourism at Udayana University in Bali, welcome the circular and urged the island's authorities to “disseminate them widely in various languages and in the form of leaflets that are easily seen and understood by tourists in both print and electronic media as well as on social media”.

;

;“The Australian embassy has previously issued a similar appeal to Australians visiting Bali,” he said. “But relevant Indonesian government officials must be more assertive and consistent in implementing the rules. Don't tolerate [unruly tourists] any more, let alone tolerating their bribes.”

;

;He also said he hopes that these recommendations will be codified into local law so violators can be punished.

;

;Azril Azahari, chairman of the Indonesian Tourism Scholars Association, recommended that the guidelines be circulated among international visitors at all ports of arrival before they apply for visas-on-arrival.

;

;“We should also apply these do's and dont's to all regions of Indonesia, not just Bali,” he said.

; Fri, 02 Jun 2023 09:20:02 +0800 In a world of conflict, only dialogue and engagement can build better relations and set a good example for next generationhttps://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3222542/world-conflict-only-dialogue-and-engagement-can-build-better-relations-and-set-good-example-next?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.02 08:15;
;;

;Courage, commitment, passion and integrity seem increasingly elusive in today's society. It falls to parents, the community and business leaders to instil these qualities into our young people. After all, they will have to deal with the major issues thrust upon them by previous generations.

;

;This reality was brought home to me recently at the 30th anniversary gala dinner for the 2023 graduates of Li Po Chun United World College of Hong Kong. The school is a member of United World Colleges, whose philosophy is focused on diversity and intercultural understanding. Their mission is to provide a life-defining educational experience.

;

;I was invited to participate in a panel discussion alongside eminent academic Kishore Mahbubani and Teresa Ma, the founder of Peace Generation. The topic was “Peace in the Future of Asia Pacific”. This is a complex, sensitive subject but one that is relevant amid heightening geopolitical tensions between China and the United States.

;

;This rise in tensions is being driven by a shift in global power. The increasing influence of China and India is the most noteworthy example from recent years, and many Southeast Asian countries have also achieved strong growth, which has enhanced the region's economic power. This is not the result of war or military threats but pragmatic economic cooperation that has lifted millions of people out of poverty.

;

;As McKinsey partners Jonathan Woetzel and Jeongmin Seong wrote in a 2019 commentary: “In the 19th century, the world was Europeanised. In the 20th century, it was Americanised. Now, it is being Asianised – and much faster than you may think.” They close by saying that, “We have entered the 'Asian century', as the author Parag Khanna puts it. There is no turning back.”

;

;During a forum in Hong Kong organised by the Singapore Chamber of Commerce last month, Mahbubani said war between China and the US was unlikely but Hong Kong should prepare to be “kicked around” like a football in the next decade. Such tactics are not advantageous to anyone, particularly our international partners. Many already benefit from our unique status and will do so for the foreseeable future.

;

;How Hong Kong must change to reap the rewards of the Asian century

;

;At the gala dinner, Mahbubani made reference to “three demons” which have led to conflict over centuries, representing the quest for power, money and greed. On a more positive note, however, he encouraged all graduates attending the ceremony to remain optimistic while being pragmatic in seeking solutions to the challenges that lie ahead.

;

;It is evident to me that respect, understanding and tolerance of others' cultural values are fundamental to an open and inclusive society. This is best achieved through dialogue and engagement. Working more closely across the international community is the only way to overcome the most difficult challenges facing humanity.

;

;We need look no further than the Association of Southeast Asian Nations for an example of what pragmatic diplomatic relations can achieve. The grouping counts democracies, autocracies, communist regimes and a monarchy among its members, and, for the most part, it is prospering and expanding its international influence while carefully balancing relations with Beijing and Washington.

;

;For me, the highlight of the evening was the introduction of two students who received scholarships at Li Po Chun United World College and had recently arrived from Afghanistan. They represent the future, and they gave the audience more hope and optimism than the adult panellists in the forum.

;

;These courageous students arrived from a war-torn country having witnessed conflict first-hand. Against all odds, they have earned an opportunity to create a new life here and make a positive contribution to the world.

;

;Listening to their story was humbling. Their hopes for a better future resonated with the audience. We should applaud their tenacity and follow their example by fostering good relations through collaboration.

;

;Scholarship programmes like these can be life-changing for the recipients who are undoubtedly bright but, more importantly, dedicated and hard-working.

;
